_header: For the meekness of Thy clean incarnation
Subjects: prayers, to Jesus; Jesus, prayers to
_description: A prayer to Jesus — thirteen roughly monorhyming lines

Lincoln91.Transcription:
ffor þe mekenes of þi clene incarnacioneAnd thurghe þe
                    meryte of þi harde passioneSafe vs fra dampnacioneSocoure vs in
                    temptacioneAnd gyffe vs thi benysoneAnd of alloure wykkidnes playne
                    perdoneAnd full remyssionethurgh verray contrissionenakede
                    confessioneAnd worthi satisfaccioneGraunte vs alswa lorde goddin
                    huene aylastande mansioneAnd euer tose þe cherefull visioneof thi
                    faire face for þe lufe þat þou schewede to mankynde
                    Amen
Lincoln91.Note:
With three-line non-rhyming prayer introduction: ‘Ihesu criste
                    goddes sone of heuen / kyng of kyngs and lorde of lordes / mi lorde & my
                    godd’.
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.  
             “Introduction.” 
             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
